data.title: Explore Will Arnett Net Worth 2024
data.meta_description: Dive into the world of Will Arnett net worth. Discover the journey behind his success and what sets him apart, only on Rachelparris.com.
data.text:
Curious about Will Arnett net worth? Rachelparris.com brings you a deep dive into the finances of the comedic genius.

From iconic roles to voice work, uncover how his career has built his fortune.

Quick Facts

FACTDETAILReal NameWilliam Emerson ArnettPopular NameWill ArnettGenderMaleBirth DateMay 4, 1970Age54 years oldParentsEmerson James Arnett, Edith Alexandra PalkSiblingsSisters, Tannis Arnett and Shanly Arnett and brother, Charles ArnettBirthplaceToronto, Ontario, CanadaNationalityCanadian-AmericanEthnicityWhiteEducationConcordia University, Lakefield College School, Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute, Leaside High School, Subway Academy IIMarital StatusDivorcedSexual OrientationStraightWife/SpouseAmy Poehler (m. 2003–2016), Penelope Ann Miller (m. 1994–1995)Children3DatingAlessandra Brawn (2019–present)Net Worth$45 MillionSource of WealthActing, Voice Acting, Producing, EndorsementsHeight6 ft 2 in (1.88 m)

What is Net Worth Of Will Arnett 2024?

As of 2024, Will Arnett, the Canadian-American actor renowned for his unique blend of satirical comedy and voice acting, boasts an impressive net worth of $45 million.

This figure places him in a distinguished league within the entertainment industry, particularly among comedians. To put this into perspective, Arnett’s net worth is comparable to that of Jason Bateman, his Arrested Development co-star and SmartLess podcast partner, who has a net worth of $50 million.

Another contemporary, Sean Hayes, also a SmartLess co-host, stands at a net worth of $30 million.

Arnett’s financial success can be attributed to his diverse career, spanning roles in popular TV shows, voice acting in major animated films, and lucrative endorsement deals with brands like GMC and Netflix.

His involvement in the high-paying podcast SmartLess also significantly contributes to his wealth, highlighting his versatility and business acumen in the entertainment industry.

Will Arnett Full Overview and Wiki

Early Life and Education

Born William Emerson Arnett on May 4, 1970, in Toronto, Canada, to parents Edith and Emerson James Arnett, Will Arnett’s journey into the world of acting was as intriguing as his roles.

Despite a brief and tumultuous stint at Lakefield College School, his passion for acting led him to the prestigious Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute in New York.

Rise to Fame

Arnett’s early career was a rollercoaster of highs and lows, with several television pilots not taking off as expected. However, his perseverance paid off when he landed the role of George Oscar Gob Bluth II in the critically acclaimed series Arrested Development.

This role not only earned him an Emmy nomination but also set the stage for a series of successful projects.

Career Highlights

Post Arrested Development, Arnett became a sought-after name in Hollywood. His filmography includes hits like Blades of Glory, where he showcased his comedic prowess alongside then-wife Amy Poehler.

His distinctive deep voice led to prominent voice-over roles in The Lego Movie and BoJack Horseman, further cementing his versatility as an actor.

Awards, Nominations and Honors

Honors:

2005: New Yorkers of the Year with Amy Poehler by New York Magazine.

2007: One of Conan O’Brien’s all-time favorite guests.

2007: Future King of Comedy by Entertainment Weekly.

2007: No. 9 in Top 15 Sexiest Nerd Boys by Best Week Ever.

2007: 20 Hottest New Faces in Comedy by Premiere magazine.

2019: Inducted into Canada Walk of Fame.

Awards and Nominations:

Won TV Land Award (2004) for Arrested Development.

Multiple Screen Actors Guild nominations for Arrested Development.

Multiple Primetime Emmy nominations for Arrested Development and 30 Rock.

Satellite Award nomination for Up All Night (2012).

American Comedy Award nomination (2014).

Kids’ Choice Award nominations for The Lego Movie and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2015).

MTV Movie & TV Awards and Teen Choice Awards nominations for The Lego Batman Movie (2017).

Won Annie Awards (2019) and Critics’ Choice Super Awards (2021) for BoJack Horseman.

Personal Life

Arnett’s personal life has been as colorful as his career. He was married to Penelope Ann Miller briefly in the mid-90s and later to comedian Amy Poehler, with whom he shares two children.

His current relationship with Alessandra Brawn has added a new chapter to his life, along with the birth of their child.

Challenges and Triumphs

Behind the laughter and fame, Arnett faced personal challenges, including a battle with alcoholism.

However, his resilience saw him overcoming these hurdles, adding depth to his performances, especially in shows like Flaked, which drew parallels to his own life experiences.

Philanthropy and Interests

Apart from his professional endeavors, Arnett is known for his philanthropic efforts and personal interests. His love for comedy and entertainment is matched by his commitment to various charitable causes, reflecting the depth of his character off-screen.

Social Media Accounts

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/arnettwill/ (524K followers)

Twitter: https://twitter.com/arnettwill (528.7K followers)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WillArnett/ (201K followers)

All About Will Arnett Latest News 2024

DICK’S Sporting Goods Campaign: Will Arnett, alongside Kathryn Hahn, stars in a new e-commerce ad campaign for DICK’S Sporting Goods. The campaign, titled “Click On DICKS.com,” showcases their online shopping experience.

‘SmartLess’ Podcast Deal: Arnett, Jason Bateman, and Sean Hayes have inked a multi-year deal with SiriusXM for their podcast ‘SmartLess’. The deal is reportedly worth a whopping $100 million!

FAQs about Will Arnett

Who is Will Arnett?

He is a Canadian-American actor best known for his role as Gob Bluth in Arrested Development and for voicing characters in BoJack Horseman and The Lego Batman Movie.

When was he born?

He was born on May 4, 1970, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

What are some of Will Arnett’s most notable roles?

Besides Arrested Development, Arnett is known for his roles in BoJack Horseman, The Lego Batman Movie, and numerous voice-over roles in commercials and animated series.

Has Arnett won any awards for his work?

While he has been nominated for several awards, including an Emmy for his role in Arrested Development, specific wins are best confirmed through awards databases and updates.

What is his background and education?

Arnett attended Lakefield College School and the Tarragon Theatre, briefly went to Concordia University, and studied acting at the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute in New York City.

Is he married?

Arnett has been married previously, including to Amy Poehler and Penelope Ann Miller. For current marital status, it’s best to refer to the latest reports as personal situations can change.

Does Will Arnett have children?

Yes, he has 3 children.

What are his hobbies and interests?

He is an avid hockey fan and workout enthusiast, known for his humor regarding his physical fitness.

How did Will Arnett and Jason Bateman’s friendship start?

Their friendship began while working together on Arrested Development, with both actors often showcasing their camaraderie through interviews, social media, and public appearances.

What are some of Will Arnett’s recent projects?

Arnett has been involved in various projects, including voice-over work, and was set to star in Is This Thing On? alongside Bradley Cooper, with Arnett writing the screenplay and Cooper directing.

Conclusion

Will Arnett’s journey is a testament to talent and tenacity, mirroring the dedication seen in the best stand-up comedians. His impressive net worth showcases his remarkable career in entertainment.
